subject: Nutrition
title: How Antibiotics Affect Your Gut
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Antibiotics Affect Your Gut usable.

hook.text: A single course of antibiotics can wipe out 30% of your gut bacteria in just a few days.

buildup.text: Antibiotics don't distinguish between harmful and helpful bacteriaâ€”they destroy both equally.

discovery.text: It can take months for your microbiome to recover, and some strains may never return.

twist.text: Children given frequent antibiotics early in life have higher rates of obesity and allergies later on.

climax.text: Eating fermented foods and fiber during and after treatment helps rebuild your gut community faster.

punchline.text: Antibiotics save lives but damage ecosystems inside you.

quiz.question: How much gut bacteria can one antibiotic course destroy?
